sections.name: Overview
content: Minecraft biomes can have different terrain characteristics. By writing custom biome data you could:
1) Change the general shape of the terrain.
2) Change the ratio of frequency of biome types.
3) Change the blocks that make up the biome, both at the surface and down below.
4) Change the distribution of decorative features like trees, grass, and flowers.
5) Change the mobs that spawn.
6) Change the climate.
7) ...and more!

sections.name: JSON Format
content: All biomes should specify the version that they target via the "format_version" field. The remainder of the biome data is divided up into independent JSON sub-objects, or components.
In general, a component defines what game behaviors a biome participates in, and the component fields define how it participates.
There are basically two categories of components:

1) Namespaced components, such as those with a 'name:' prefix, that map to specific behaviors in-game. They may have member fields that parameterize that behavior. Only names that have a valid mapping are supported.

2) 'tags' which are defined under the "minecraft:tags" component. Tags consist of alphanumeric characters, along with '.' and '_'. A tag is attached to the biome so that either code or data may check for its existence.
Here is a sample biome schema with additional details and the full list of namespaced components.
"plains": {
"format_version": "1.20.60",
"minecraft:climate": {
"downfall": 0.4,
"snow_accumulation": [ 0.0, 0.125 ],
"temperature": 0.8
"minecraft:overworld_height": {
"noise_type": "lowlands"
"minecraft:surface_parameters": {
"sea_floor_depth": 7,
"sea_floor_material": "minecraft:gravel",
"foundation_material": "minecraft:stone",
"mid_material": "minecraft:dirt",
"top_material": "minecraft:grass_block"
"minecraft:overworld_generation_rules": {
"hills_transformation": [
[ "forest_hills", 1 ],
[ "forest", 2 ]
"mutate_transformation": "sunflower_plains",
"generate_for_climates": [
[ "medium", 3 ],
[ "cold", 1 ]
"minecraft:tags": {
"tags": [
"animal",
"monster",
"overworld",
"plains"

sections.name: Adding Biomes
content: Biomes are read from JSON files in the biomes subfolders of behavior packs. Loading enforces one biome per file; and the file name and the actual biome name must match. Adding a file with a new name to the biome data location will make it available for the game to use, while existing biomes can be overridden using files that match their existing name. Note that if you add a new biome, you'll need to write component data that allows it to participate in world generation (as shown in the full schema below), or else it won't show up in your worlds!

sections.name: Biome Components
content: Any components that this Biome uses

rows.Name: minecraft:capped_surface
rows.Description: Generates surface on blocks with non-solid blocks above or below.

rows.Name: minecraft:climate
rows.Description: Describes temperature, humidity, precipitation, and similar. Biomes without this component will have default values.

rows.Name: minecraft:frozen_ocean_surface
rows.Description: Similar to overworld_surface. Adds icebergs.

rows.Name: minecraft:mesa_surface
rows.Description: Similar to overworld_surface. Adds colored strata and optional pillars.

rows.Name: minecraft:mountain_parameters
rows.Description: Noise parameters used to drive mountain terrain generation in Overworld.

rows.Name: minecraft:multinoise_generation_rules
rows.Description: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the nether.

rows.Name: minecraft:overworld_generation_rules
rows.Description: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the overworld.

rows.Name: minecraft:overworld_height
rows.Description: Noise parameters used to drive terrain height in the Overworld.

rows.Name: minecraft:surface_material_adjustments
rows.Description: Specify fine-detail changes to blocks used in terrain generation (based on a noise function).

rows.Name: minecraft:surface_parameters
rows.Description: Controls the blocks used for the default Minecraft Overworld terrain generation.

rows.Name: minecraft:swamp_surface
rows.Description: Similar to overworld_surface. Adds swamp surface details.

rows.Name: minecraft:tags
rows.Description: Attach arbitrary string tags to this biome.

rows.Name: minecraft:the_end_surface
rows.Description: Use default Minecraft End terrain generation.

sections.name: Biome Definition
content: Contains a description and components to define a Biome.

rows.Name: components
rows.Description: Components for this Biome.

rows.Name: description
rows.Description: Non-component settings, including the Biome name.

sections.name: Biome Description
content: Contains non-component settings for a Biome.

rows.Name: identifier
rows.Description: The name of the Biome, used by other features like the '/locate biome' command.

sections.name: Biome JSON File
content: Contains a format version and a biome definition

rows.Name: format_version
rows.Description: Version of the JSON schema used by this file

rows.Name: minecraft:biome
rows.Description: A single biome definition

sections.name: Block Specifier
content: Specifies a particular block. Can be a string block name or a JSON object

rows.Name: name
rows.Description: Name of the block

rows.Name: states
rows.Description: Contains members named after each state, with boolean, integer, or string values.

sections.name: Molang Expression
content: A JSON field that specifies a Molang expression. Can be an integer, float, boolean, or string.

sections.name: minecraft:capped_surface
content: Generates surface on blocks with non-solid blocks above or below.

rows.Name: beach_material
rows.Description: Material used to decorate surface near sea level.

rows.Name: ceiling_materials
rows.Type: Array of Object of type Block Specifier
rows.Description: Materials used for the surface ceiling.

rows.Name: floor_materials
rows.Type: Array of Object of type Block Specifier
rows.Description: Materials used for the surface floor.

rows.Name: foundation_material
rows.Description: Material used to replace solid blocks that are not surface blocks.

rows.Name: sea_material
rows.Description: Material used to replace air blocks below sea level.

sections.name: minecraft:climate
content: Describes temperature, humidity, precipitation, and similar. Biomes without this component will have default values.

rows.Name: ash
rows.Description: Density of ash precipitation visuals

rows.Name: blue_spores
rows.Description: Density of blue spore precipitation visuals

rows.Name: downfall
rows.Description: Amount that precipitation affects colors and block changes

rows.Name: red_spores
rows.Description: Density of blue spore precipitation visuals

rows.Name: snow_accumulation
rows.Description: Minimum and maximum snow level, each multiple of 0.125 is another snow layer

rows.Name: temperature
rows.Description: Temperature affects a variety of visual and behavioral things, including snow and ice placement, sponge drying, and sky color

rows.Name: white_ash
rows.Description: Density of white ash precipitation visuals

sections.name: minecraft:frozen_ocean_surface
content: Similar to overworld_surface. Adds icebergs.

rows.Name: foundation_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome

rows.Name: mid_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome

rows.Name: sea_floor_depth
rows.Description: Controls how deep below the world water level the floor should occur

rows.Name: sea_floor_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome

rows.Name: sea_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the bodies of water in this biome

rows.Name: top_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome

sections.name: minecraft:mesa_surface
content: Similar to overworld_surface. Adds colored strata and optional pillars.

rows.Name: bryce_pillars
rows.Description: Whether the mesa generates with pillars

rows.Name: clay_material
rows.Description: Base clay block to use

rows.Name: foundation_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome

rows.Name: hard_clay_material
rows.Description: Hardened clay block to use

rows.Name: has_forest
rows.Description: Places coarse dirt and grass at high altitudes

rows.Name: mid_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome

rows.Name: sea_floor_depth
rows.Description: Controls how deep below the world water level the floor should occur

rows.Name: sea_floor_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome

rows.Name: sea_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the bodies of water in this biome

rows.Name: top_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome

sections.name: minecraft:mountain_parameters
content: Noise parameters used to drive mountain terrain generation in Overworld.

rows.Name: peaks_factor
rows.Description: Does nothing

rows.Name: steep_material_adjustment
rows.Type: Object of type minecraft:mountain_parameters - steep_material_adjustment settings
rows.Description: Defines surface material for steep slopes

rows.Name: top_slide
rows.Type: Object of type minecraft:mountain_parameters - top_slide settings
rows.Description: Controls the density tapering that happens at the top of the world to prevent terrain from reaching too high

sections.name: minecraft:mountain_parameters - steep_material_adjustment settings
content: Defines surface material for steep slopes

rows.Name: east_slopes
rows.Description: Enable for east-facing slopes

rows.Name: material
rows.Description: Block type use as steep material

rows.Name: north_slopes
rows.Description: Enable for north-facing slopes

rows.Name: south_slopes
rows.Description: Enable for south-facing slopes

rows.Name: west_slopes
rows.Description: Enable for west-facing slopes

sections.name: minecraft:mountain_parameters - top_slide settings
content: Controls the density tapering that happens at the top of the world to prevent terrain from reaching too high.

rows.Name: enabled
rows.Description: If false, top slide will be disabled. If true, other parameters will be taken into account.

sections.name: minecraft:multinoise_generation_rules
content: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the nether.

rows.Name: target_altitude
rows.Description: Altitude with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

rows.Name: target_humidity
rows.Description: Humidity with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

rows.Name: target_temperature
rows.Description: Temperature with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

rows.Name: target_weirdness
rows.Description: Weirdness with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

rows.Name: weight
rows.Description: Weight with which this biome should be generated, relative to other biomes.

sections.name: minecraft:overworld_generation_rules
content: Controls how this biome is instantiated (and then potentially modified) during world generation of the overworld.

rows.Name: generate_for_climates
rows.Type: Array of Object of type minecraft:overworld_generation_rules - Weighted climate categories settings
rows.Description: Controls the world generation climate categories that this biome can spawn for. A single biome can be associated with multiple categories with different weightings.

rows.Name: hills_transformation
rows.Type: Object of type minecraft:overworld_generation_rules - Weighted biome names settings
rows.Description: What biome to switch to when converting to a hilly biome

rows.Name: mutate_transformation
rows.Type: Object of type minecraft:overworld_generation_rules - Weighted biome names settings
rows.Description: What biome to switch to when converting to a mutated biome

rows.Name: river_transformation
rows.Type: Object of type minecraft:overworld_generation_rules - Weighted biome names settings
rows.Description: What biome to switch to when converting to a river biome (if not the Vanilla 'river' biome)

rows.Name: shore_transformation
rows.Type: Object of type minecraft:overworld_generation_rules - Weighted biome names settings
rows.Description: What biome to switch to when adjacent to an ocean biome

sections.name: minecraft:overworld_generation_rules - Weighted biome names settings
content: Can be just the string name of a Biome, or an array of any size. If an array, each entry can be a Biome name string, or an array of size 2, where the first entry is a Biome name and the second entry is a positive integer representing how that Biome is weighted against other entries. If no weight is provided, a weight of 1 is used.

sections.name: minecraft:overworld_generation_rules - Weighted climate categories settings
content: An array of any size containing arrays of exactly two elements. For each contained array, the first element is a climate category string ('medium', 'warm', 'lukewarm', 'cold', or 'frozen'). The second element is a positive integer for how much that entry is weighted relative to other entries.

sections.name: minecraft:overworld_height
content: Noise parameters used to drive terrain height in the Overworld.

rows.Name: noise_params
rows.Description: First value is depth - more negative means deeper underwater, while more positive means higher. Second value is scale, which affects how much noise changes as it moves from the surface.

rows.Name: noise_type
rows.Description: Specifies a preset based on a built-in setting rather than manually using noise_params

sections.name: minecraft:surface_material_adjustments
content: Specify fine-detail changes to blocks used in terrain generation (based on a noise function).

rows.Name: adjustments
rows.Type: Array of Object of type minecraft:surface_material_adjustments - surface adjustment settings
rows.Description: All adjustments that match the column's noise values will be applied in the order listed.

sections.name: minecraft:surface_material_adjustments - surface adjustment materials settings
content: The specific blocks used for this surface adjustment

rows.Name: foundation_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome when this adjustment is active.

rows.Name: mid_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome when this adjustment is active.

rows.Name: sea_floor_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome when this adjustment is active.

rows.Name: sea_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used in the bodies of water in this biome when this adjustment is active.

rows.Name: top_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome when this adjustment is active.

sections.name: minecraft:surface_material_adjustments - surface adjustment settings
content: An adjustment to generated terrain, replacing blocks based on the specified settings.

rows.Name: height_range
rows.Description: Defines a range of noise values [min, max] for which this adjustment should be applied.

rows.Name: materials
rows.Type: Object of type minecraft:surface_material_adjustments - surface adjustment materials settings

rows.Name: noise_frequency_scale
rows.Description: The scale to multiply by the position when accessing the noise value for the material adjustments.

rows.Name: noise_range
rows.Description: Defines a range of noise values [min, max] for which this adjustment should be applied.

sections.name: minecraft:surface_parameters
content: Controls the blocks used for the default Minecraft Overworld terrain generation.

rows.Name: foundation_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome.

rows.Name: mid_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome.

rows.Name: sea_floor_depth
rows.Description: Controls how deep below the world water level the floor should occur.

rows.Name: sea_floor_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome.

rows.Name: sea_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the bodies of water in this biome.

rows.Name: top_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome.

sections.name: minecraft:swamp_surface
content: Similar to overworld_surface. Adds swamp surface details.

rows.Name: foundation_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used deep underground in this biome.

rows.Name: mid_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used in a layer below the surface of this biome.

rows.Name: sea_floor_depth
rows.Description: Controls how deep below the world water level the floor should occur.

rows.Name: sea_floor_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used as a floor for bodies of water in this biome.

rows.Name: sea_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the bodies of water in this biome.

rows.Name: top_material
rows.Description: Controls the block type used for the surface of this biome.

sections.name: minecraft:tags
content: Attach arbitrary string tags to this biome.

rows.Name: tags
rows.Description: Array of string tags used by other systems such as entity spawning

sections.name: minecraft:the_end_surface
content: Use default Minecraft End terrain generation.
